    • Method Detail

      • isAuthenticated

        boolean isAuthenticated()
        Returns:
        true if the there is an authenticated principal attached to the current thread and it is not anonymous

      • hasAuthority

        boolean hasAuthority(String authority)
        Checks if the authenticated principal has the matching authority. This does a String based comparison on GrantedAuthority.getAuthority(), whereas hasAuthority(GrantedAuthority) will perform an equality check on the actual GrantedAuthority instance.

        String based authority checks are usually safest to use.

        Parameters:
        authority - string the authentication should have
        Returns:
        true if authority string was present

      • hasAuthority

        boolean hasAuthority(org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority authority)
        Checks if the authenticated principal has the matching exact authority. This does an equality check on the GrantedAuthority instance, meaning the type will be taken into account. In most cases using authority strings is enough, see hasAuthority(String).
        Parameters:
        authority - instance the authentication should have
        Returns:
        true if authority instance was present

      • getPrincipal

        SecurityPrincipal getPrincipal()
        Returns:
        the backing SecurityPrincipal instance

      • getPrincipal

        <V extends SecurityPrincipal> V getPrincipal(Class<V> principalType)
        Return the SecurityPrincipal instance that is being proxied if and only if it is of the required type. In case there is a principal that does not match the type, null will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        V - type of the principal
        Parameters:
        principalType - expected type of the principal
        Returns:
        instance of available and of the required type, null otherwise
